analyzed: bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin zhes bya ba ni ji ltar lam chung ngu'i chung ngus nyon mongs pa'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po spong ba nas chen po'i chen pos chung ngu'i chung du spong ba'i bar lam rnam pa dgus nyon mongs pa

original: rnam pa dgu spong ba de bzhin du log par lta ba chung ngu'i chung ngus dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po kun du gcod pa nas chen po'i chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu kun du gcod pa'i bar log
analyzed: rnam pa dgu spong ba de bzhin du log par lta ba chung ngu'i chung ngus dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam pa chen po'i chen po kun du gcod pa nas chen po'i chen pos dge ba'i rtsa ba'i rnam pa chung ngu'i chung ngu kun du gcod pa'i bar log
translated: Just as the nine types of virtue are severed by the nine types of wrong view, so too the small-small type of wrong view severs the great-great type of virtue, up to the great-great type of wrong view severing the small-small type of virtue.

original: par lta ba rnam pa dgus kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu kun du gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par lta ba rnam pa dgus kyang dge ba'i rtsa ba rnam pa dgu kun du gcod par 'gyur ro //

original: de ltar na gzhung 'di bskyabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag ji skad bshad pa ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du kun du 'chad na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhung 'di bskyabs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni gal te de dag ji skad bshad pa ltar bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa bzhin du kun du 'chad na'o //
translated: Thus, this treatise is protected means that if they are severed as explained, then they are severed like the afflictions that are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

analyzed: phra mo dang lhan cig tu gyur pa zhes bya ba ni chung ngu'i chung ngu'o //

original: de ni rdzogs pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa rdzogs pa las dgongs te 'di skad du /
analyzed: de ni rdzogs pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa rdzogs pa las dgongs te 'di skad du /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of complete severance of the roots of virtue.üîΩThe great of the great nonvirtuous roots are explained in detail in the Abhidharmako≈õa.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po gang dag yin zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad pa yin te chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa kun du 'chad pa ni mi smos kyang gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba chen po gang dag yin zhe na zhes bya ba rgyas par bshad pa yin te chung ngu'i chung ngu la sogs pa kun du 'chad pa ni mi smos kyang gzung bar bya'o //

original: de lta bas na de dag gis ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir de ni rdzogs pa kho na la dgongs nas bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag gis ma lus pa gcod pa'i phyir de ni rdzogs pa kho na la dgongs nas bshad pa yin te /

original: 'di ltar log yin par ltab rnam pa dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma lus par gcod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar log yin par ltab rnam pa dgus dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams ma lus par gcod par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the roots of virtue are severed by nine types of wrong views.

original: de dag las las rnam pa gcig ste /
analyzed: de dag las las rnam pa gcig ste /
translated: Among them, one type of action

original: rnam pa dgu pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ma chad na yang rnam pa dgu po thams cad yang skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa dgu pa chung ngu'i chung ngu ma chad na yang rnam pa dgu po thams cad yang skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni rdzogs pa las dgongs te gsungs pa yin no //

original: gnyi gar gcod par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni langs na yang gcod par byed ma langs na yang gcod par byed do //üîΩde btang bas de yang gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni sems chung ngu'i chung ngus sdom pa de yang dag par blangs par gyur pa'i sems chung @63a * //
analyzed: gnyi gar gcod par byed do zhes bya ba 'di ni langs na yang gcod par byed ma langs na yang gcod par byed do // de btang bas de yang gtong ngo zhes bya ba ni sems chung ngu'i chung ngus sdom pa de yang dag par blangs par gyur pa'i sems chung @63a * //
translated: It is said that one severs the roots of virtue in both ways means that one severs them by rising from meditative attainment and by not rising from meditative attainment.

original: ngu'i chung ngu dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'i chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang zhing kun du chad na sdom pa de yang btang bar 'gyur ba nas /
analyzed: ngu'i chung ngu dge ba'i rtsa ba chung ngu'i chung ngu dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang zhing kun du chad na sdom pa de yang btang bar 'gyur ba nas /

original: de bzhin du gang zhig rgyu mtshan chen po'i chen bos sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de btang bas de yang gtong ba'i bar du 'gyur ro ;üîΩ/ las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la bdag gang nas 'chi 'phos te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gang zhig rgyu mtshan chen po'i chen bos sdom pa yang dag par blangs pa de btang bas de yang gtong ba'i bar du 'gyur ro ; / las kyi 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni lha'i bu skyes nas ring po ma lon pa la bdag gang nas 'chi 'phos te /
translated: Similarly, one who has taken up the vows with a great reason, even if he relinquishes them, will not sever his root of virtue.üîΩBecause the effect of karma is directly perceived.

original: gang du ni skyes gang zhig gis skyes snyam pa'i sems gsum kun du 'byung ste /
analyzed: gang du ni skyes gang zhig gis skyes snyam pa'i sems gsum kun du 'byung ste /

analyzed: de ltar las dang 'bras bu mngon sum du gyur pa'i phyir lha dag gi nang na dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa med do //
translated: Because the effect of karma is directly perceived, the root of virtue is not severed among gods.

original: 'dzam bu'i gling kho na yod do zhes bya ba ni de na khyad par du rtog ge ba nyid yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dzam bu'i gling kho na yod do zhes bya ba ni de na khyad par du rtog ge ba nyid yod pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: Only in Jambudvƒ´pa.

original: thams cad pas nyung na dbang po brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: thams cad pas nyung na dbang po brgyad dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: The minimum is possessing eight faculties.

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du chad pa kho na tshor ba'i dbang po lnga dang lus dang srog dang yid kyi dbang po dang ldan no //
translated: Those who have completely severed their wholesome roots possess five faculties of feeling, the body faculty, the life faculty, the mental faculty, and the faculty of equanimity.

original: de'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ni kun du 'chad do //
analyzed: de'i dad pa la sogs pa'i dbang po ni kun du 'chad do //

analyzed: so so'i skye bo yin pa'i phyir mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po la sogs pa la yang med do //

analyzed: mig dag la sogs pa'i dbang po yang mtshang ba'i tshul lam rim gyis 'chi ba'i gnas skabs na med do //

original: shar gyi lus 'phags po dang nub kyi ba lang spyod pa yang de dang 'dra'o zhes mthun par bsgres pa'i phyir de dag na yang dge ba'i rtsa ba kun du 'chad pa yod do zhes bya bar ston par byed do //

analyzed: skyes pa bud med kyis gcod do zhes bya ba ni skyed pa dang bud med kyis zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The sutra says that they are severed by a man or a woman,üîΩbut it does not say that they are severed by oneself or another.

analyzed: dang zhes bya ba'i sgra mi mngon par bstan pa yin no //

original: gang mo'i dbang po dang ldan ba de gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan te /
analyzed: gang mo'i dbang po dang ldan ba de gdon mi za bar dbang po brgyad dang ldan te /

analyzed: tshor ba'i dbang po bzhi dang lus dang srog dang yid kyi gsum dang brgyad pa mo'i dbang po dang ldan no //

original: dad pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dad pa la sogs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Faith and so on are not included because

analyzed: mig la sogs pa yang snga ma bzhin du 'khrul par 'gyur te /

original: 'dir ni don 'di kho na dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir ni don 'di kho na dang 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, this meaning is contradictory.üîΩAlso from those, means also from those faculties that sever as explained.

original: de dag las kyang zhes bya ba ni kun du gcod par byed pa ji skad bshad pa de @63b dag las kyang sred pa spyad pa ni kun du gcod par byed do //
analyzed: de dag las kyang zhes bya ba ni kun du gcod par byed pa ji skad bshad pa de @63b dag las kyang sred pa spyad pa ni kun du gcod par byed do //

original: sdig pa'i bsam pa brtan pa dang mkhyud pa can yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di la sdig pa la bsam pa sems pa brtan pa yod pas zhes bya bar tshig bsdu ba ste /

original: brtan pa ni sran la sgre ba'o //
analyzed: brtan pa ni sran la sgre ba'o //

original: sdig pa mi dge ba mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba mkhyud pa ni 'chab pa'o //
translated: Evil means ‚Äúnonvirtuous.‚Äù To conceal means to hide.

analyzed: ji ltar sred pa spyad pa bsam pa g-yo ba yin pa ltar ma ning la sogs pa la yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as the practice of craving is fickle, so too are the practice of being a eunuch and so on.

original: ngan song ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ngan song ba rnams shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du mi gcod pa ltar ma ning la sogs pa yang de
analyzed: ngan song ba bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar ngan song ba rnams shes rab nyon mongs pa can dang nyon mongs pa ma yin pa dag mi brtan pa'i phyir dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams kun du mi gcod pa ltar ma ning la sogs pa yang de
translated: Like those in the lower rebirths means just as those in the lower rebirths do not sever their roots of virtue because their afflicted and unafflicted wisdom is unstable, so too are eunuchs and so on.

original: dang 'dra'o // nying mtshams sbyar zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyar bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: dang 'dra'o // nying mtshams sbyar zhes bya ba ni nying mtshams sbyar bar byas pa'o //

analyzed: nad med nas stobs rnyed pa bzhin no zhes bya ba ni ji ltar sngar nad med par 'gyur la rim gyis stobs rnyed par 'gyur ba de dang 'dra'o //

original: mtshams med byed pa'i 'di la min //
analyzed: mtshams med byed pa'i 'di la min //
translated: But not for one who has committed heinous acts.üîΩThis means that one who has committed a heinous act does not link with this rebirth existence.

analyzed: rgyu'i stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gang dag skal ba mnyam pa'i stobs kyis bdag nyid log par lta bar 'dod pa'o //

analyzed: rkyen gyi stobs kyis zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar gang dag gzhan gyi sgra'i stobs kyis log par lta bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: The power of conditions refers to those who, by the power of the words of another, wish to adopt wrong views.

original: rgyu'i stobs ni snying po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu'i stobs ni snying po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The power of the cause is stronger than the power of the conditions.üîΩThe same applies to those who sever the wholesome roots by their own power and those who sever them by the power of another.

analyzed: gzhan las thos pa tsam gyi stobs kyis gcod pa de ni skye ba na'o //

analyzed: ba mngon du gyur pas nyams shing ma rung ba ste /

analyzed: de ni mthong ba'i chos kho na nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ni lus zhig nas nying mtshams sbyor bar 'gyur ro //

translated: Similarly, one who has impaired view and one who has impaired view and ethics are synonyms for those just explained.

original: rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ston pa drug po 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rdzogs byed la sogs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ston pa drug po 'di lta ste /

translated: It is true that it is necessary to state that,

analyzed: chags pa yis ni rdzogs par byed //

analyzed: nyon mongs pa can kun kyal pa nyid ces 'byung ba'i phyir de nyid tshig kyal pa yang yin no //

analyzed: ji ltar zhe na de la ni yid kyi gcig yin la ngag gi gsum yin no zhes bya ba smos te /

analyzed: brdzun du smra na yang brnab sems sam gnod sems gcig dang ngag gi gsum ste /

analyzed: tshig rtsub po smra na yang yid kyi gcig ste gnod sems dang / ngag gi gsum ste /

analyzed: tshig rtsub po dang phra ma dang tshig kyal pa @65b dag go //

analyzed: ming gi sgo nas de ltar gsum yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sgo nas ni ma yin te /

analyzed: brdzun du smra ba de nyid la phra ma dang / tshig kyal pa zhes kyang bya'i ngo bo nyid gsum yod pa ni ma yin no //

analyzed: de bzhin du tshig rtsub po la yang ming gsum yin no zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //

original: gzhan dag na re ngo bo nyid kyi khyad par yang yod de brdzun du smra ba dang phra ma dang tshig kyal pa'i rnam par reg byed ma yin pas bdag kyang tha dad la de bzhin du tshig rtsub po dang phra ma dang tshig kyal pa rnam par

translated: Others say: There is also a difference in their nature, because lying, slander and idle speech are different from nonindicative form, and likewise harsh speech, slander and idle speech are different from nonindicative form.

analyzed: rig byed ma yin pa dag kyang tha dad do zhes zer ro //

translated: And three karmic paths of killing and so on are completed and perfect through the preparation of covetousness and so on.

analyzed: sems pa lnga pa dang drug pa bdun dang yang de bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //

translated: Also, contaminated karma other than the path of abandonment, whether it is equipoise or nonequipoise, is karma possessing a result that is four results, excluding the result of separation.

original: spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu ni med do //üîΩde'i rnam par @71a * //
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu ni med do // de'i rnam par @71a * //

original: smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'am /üîΩyid du mi 'ong ba yin no //
analyzed: smin pa'i 'bras bu ni rang gi sar gtogs pa'i rnam par smin pa yid du 'ong ba 'am / yid du mi 'ong ba yin no //
translated: Its maturational result is the pleasant or unpleasant karmic maturation that belongs to its level.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni ting nge 'dzin las skyes pa'i chos 'dra ba phyi ma rnams so //üîΩskyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni des drangs pa'i chos lhan cig 'byung ba 'am /

translated: Its result of natural outflow is subsequent states of similar type that arise from concentration.

original: mjug thogs su 'byung ba rnams so //
analyzed: mjug thogs su 'byung ba rnams so //
translated: Its result of conscious effort is phenomena that arise simultaneously or immediately after it is induced by concentration.

original: lhag ma bdag po'i 'bras bu ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: lhag ma bdag po'i 'bras bu ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Its remaining result, the dominant result, is as before.

original: zag pa med pa lhag ma dang // zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zag pa med pa lhag ma dang // zhes bya ba la /

original: lhag ma zhes smos pa ni spong ba'i lam bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes smos pa ni spong ba'i lam bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The remaining dharmas are the remaining dharmas because they exclude the path of abandonment.

original: de yang sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam dag la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de yang sbyor ba dang / rnam par grol ba dang / khyad par gyi lam dag la yod pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: They are the dharmas that exist on the path of preparation, the path of liberation, and the special path.

original: de ni spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /
analyzed: de ni spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /

original: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
analyzed: zag pa med pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
translated: They are not the result of karmic maturation because they are uncontaminated.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du yod do //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du yod do //
translated: The remaining results are as before.

original: lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa'i las gang yin pa ste /

original: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa de yang gsum gyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dang / ma bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa de yang gsum gyis 'bras bu dang bcas pa yin te /

original: spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir de la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /
analyzed: spong ba'i lam ma yin pa'i phyir de la bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med la /

original: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med do //
translated: It is not the result of karmic maturation because it is neutral.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du yod pa kho na'o //
translated: The rest are as before.

original: dge ba'i dge ba la sogs pa ni /
analyzed: dge ba'i dge ba la sogs pa ni /
translated: The virtuous, etc.,

original: bzhi dang gnyis dang de bzhin gsum //
analyzed: bzhi dang gnyis dang de bzhin gsum //
translated: have four, two, and three effects.

original: zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba 'di ni go rims ji lta ba bzhin te /
translated: This is in accordance with the order of the above verse.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: What is the meaning of this?

original: dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i 'bras bu chos dge ba ni bzhi'o //
translated: The virtuous effect of a virtuous cause is fourfold.

original: de nyid kyi 'bras bu mi dge ba ni gnyis so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'bras bu mi dge ba ni gnyis so //
translated: The nonvirtuous effect of a virtuous cause is twofold.

original: de nyid kyi 'bras bu lung du ma bstan pa ni gsum mo zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi 'bras bu lung du ma bstan pa ni gsum mo zhes bya ba yin no //

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The effect of separation is excluded because the effect of separation is neutral.

original: mi dge ba gnyis te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go //üîΩrgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni med de /
analyzed: mi dge ba gnyis te zhes bya ba ni skyes bu byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag go // rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni med de /

analyzed: 'di ltar dge ba rnams kyi skal ba mnyam pa'i rgyu ni chos dge ba rnams yin pas so //

analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu yang med de /

analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par smin pa ni lung du ma bstan pa yin pa'i phyir la /

analyzed: mi dge ba dag ni rnam par smin pa'i phyir lung du ma bstan pa yin pas so // bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med de /

original: mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not have the result of separation because they are nonvirtuous.

original: shugs kyis na skyes bu @71b byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag yin te /
analyzed: shugs kyis na skyes bu @71b byed pa dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu dag yin te /
translated: By implication, they have the results of conscious effort and dominant result,

original: de dag ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni snga ma bzhin du bshad par bya'o //
translated: which should be explained as before.üîΩNeutral states have four results.

original: lung du ma bstan pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ji ltar mi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dag yin zhe na /
analyzed: lung du ma bstan pa ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba ji ltar mi dge ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dag yin zhe na /
translated: How can neutral states be the result of natural outflow of nonvirtuous states?

original: ji ltar yin par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: ji ltar yin par mi 'gyur /
translated: Why would they not be?

original: mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mi 'dra ba'i phyir te /

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa dang / rnam par smin pa med pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because they possess karmic maturation and do not possess karmic maturation.üîΩNonvirtuous states are dissimilar to neutral states.

original: mi dge ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dag dang mi 'dra'o zhe na de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: mi dge ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos dag dang mi 'dra'o zhe na de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no error.

original: mi dge ba dang lung du ma bstan pa'i chos rnams ni nyon mongs pa can du 'dra ba nyid kyis 'dra ba yod do //üîΩde lta bas na bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa rnams kyang mi dge ba dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur rung la /

analyzed: mi dge ba rnams kyang bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa dag gi rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bur rung ngo //

analyzed: de'i phyir / lung du ma bstan pa zhes bya ba rgyas par smos te /
translated: Therefore the root text states,üîΩThe afflicted view of the self and extreme view are the result of natural outflow of nonvirtuous pervasive states abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering and origin

original: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag ni mi dge ba kun du 'gro ba sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin te /üîΩskal mnyam kun du 'gro ba yi //
analyzed: 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba dag ni mi dge ba kun du 'gro ba sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba rnams dang / sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yin te / skal mnyam kun du 'gro ba yi //
translated: and the result of natural outflow of attachment and so on abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.üîΩBecause it is said,

original: 'bras bu rgyu mthun zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu rgyu mthun zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The homogeneous cause is the result of natural outflow.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni zhes bya ba rgyas par 'byung ba ni /
translated: Nonvirtuous karmas are the opposite of that.üîΩ

original: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba ris lnga pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyi 'bras bu yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la sogs pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i mi dge ba ris lnga pa rnams ni lung du ma bstan pa'i 'jig tshogs dang / mthar 'dzin par lta ba gnyis kyi 'bras bu yin no //
translated: The five types of nonvirtuous entities that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering, etc., are the results of the two views that are indeterminate: the view that grasps an entity as real and the view that grasps extremes.

original: de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag kho na yin no zhes bya ba ni rnam par smin pa dang bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa gsum mo //
translated: The results of these two views are only these two views.

original: 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gsum pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos ni bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las kyi 'bras bu dus gsum pa 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i chos ni bzhi'o //
translated: The results of past karma that are present entities are four in number, excluding the result that consists of natural outcome.

original: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de ni khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bral ba'i 'bras bu ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni de ni khams su ma gtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result that consists of natural outcome is excluded because it does not belong to a realm.

original: ji ltar byas pas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar byas pas she na /
translated: How is this so?

original: 'das pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i rnam par smin pa 'das pa phyi ma yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni de'i rnam par smin pa 'das pa phyi ma yin no //
translated: The result of the karmic maturation of past karma is a future karmic maturation.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni des drangs pa 'das pa lhan cig skyes pa 'am /üîΩphyis mjug thogs su 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni des drangs pa 'das pa lhan cig skyes pa 'am / phyis mjug thogs su 'das pa yin no //
translated: The result of conscious effort is either simultaneous with the action or subsequent to it.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'das pa de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa @72a * //üîΩrnams dang / phyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams yin no //üîΩrgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni phyis 'byung ba'i chos 'dra ba rnams yin no //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni 'das pa de dang lhan cig 'byung ba rang gi ngo bo ma gtogs pa @72a * // rnams dang / phyis 'byung ba'i chos rnams yin no // rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni phyis 'byung ba'i chos 'dra ba rnams yin no //
translated: The dominant result is either simultaneous with the action or subsequent to it.üîΩThe homogeneous result is a later phenomenon that is similar to the action.

original: 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni de'i rnam par smin pa yin no //üîΩskyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gang gi stobs kyis chos ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa de yin no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni de'i rnam par smin pa yin no // skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni gang gi stobs kyis chos ma 'ongs pa 'thob pa de yin no //
translated: The maturational result is a later phenomenon that is similar to the action.üîΩThe result of conscious effort is a later phenomenon that is similar to the action.

original: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bdag po'i 'bras bu ni de'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The dominant result is a later phenomenon that is similar to the action.

original: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ni de dang 'dra ba ma 'ongs pa yin no //
translated: The homogeneous result is a later phenomenon that is similar to the action.

original: da ltar byung ba dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba dag kyang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: The same applies to present actions.

original: 'das pa de'i 'bras bu bzhi sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩbar ma yi ni ma 'ongs pa'ang //üîΩzhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu chos ma 'ongs pa yang bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'das pa de'i 'bras bu bzhi sbyar bar bya'o // bar ma yi ni ma 'ongs pa'ang // zhes bya ba ni da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu chos ma 'ongs pa yang bzhi'o //
translated: The four results of past action should be applied in the same way.üîΩThe future result of present actionüîΩis fourfold.

original: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid do zhes bya ba ni bral ba'i 'bras bu ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The future result of present action is fourfold, excluding the result of separation.

original: de dag kyang de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang de kho na bzhin du sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Those results should be applied in the same way.üîΩThe present result of present action is two results:

original: da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu de ltar byung ba'i chos ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig byung ba ni de'i stobs las skyes pa yin pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i 'bras bu de ltar byung ba'i chos ni gnyis te zhes bya ba ni de dang lhan cig byung ba ni de'i stobs las skyes pa yin pas skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu dang / bdag po'i 'bras bu kho na yin gyi /
translated: The present result of present action is two results: the result of conscious effort and the dominant result.

original: bral ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med cing /
analyzed: bral ba'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med cing /
translated: The result of separation does not exist because it is not by nature separation.

original: snga phyi nyid med pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang med la /
analyzed: snga phyi nyid med pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu yang med la /
translated: The result of natural outflow does not exist because there is no prior or subsequent state.

original: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir da ltar gyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu da ltar byung ba yang med do //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni rgyu la ltos pa'i phyir da ltar gyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu da ltar byung ba yang med do //
translated: The present effect of the present cause is the effect of conscious effort.

original: rgyu mthun pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni med de /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa dang / bral ba'i 'bras bu dag ma gtogs so zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa'i rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni med de /
translated: The effect of separation does not exist in the future because separation is not future.

original: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag med de /
analyzed: 'di ltar ma 'ongs pa'i skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyu dag med de /
translated: The effect of natural outflow does not exist in the future because homogeneous and omnipresent causes do not exist in the future.

original: de na 'tshol bar 'dug pa'i phyir dang / 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbral ba'i 'bras bu yang med de /
analyzed: de na 'tshol bar 'dug pa'i phyir dang / 'dra ba nyid kyi phyir 'di'i 'bras bu 'di'o zhes yongs su gcad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // bral ba'i 'bras bu yang med de /
translated: The effect of natural outflow is not distinguished from its cause, and it is not possible to determine that this is the effect of that cause because the future is not established as a place where one searches for it.

original: 'di ltar bral ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bral ba ni ma 'ongs pa yang ma yin no //
translated: The effect of separation does not exist in the future because separation is not future.

original: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur ni 'byung ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bur ni 'byung ste /
translated: The effect of karmic maturation exists in the future.

original: mi dge ba'am dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni phyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: mi dge ba'am dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa ma 'ongs pa'i rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ma 'ongs pa ni phyis skye bar 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: The future result of karmic maturation of future nonvirtuous or contaminated virtuous karma is that which will arise later.

original: skyes bu byed pa'i 'bras bu ni ma 'ongs pa lhan cig skyes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa mjug thogs su 'byung ba yin no //

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa gzhan yang yin no zhes bya ba ni tshor ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is also the other, i.e., the result of the karma that is to be experienced in other lives, i.e., feeling, etc.

original: las dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa de dag ni sems pa zhes bya ba'i las dang lhan cig mi 'byung la /
analyzed: las dang lhan cig mi 'byung ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar snyoms par 'jug pa de dag ni sems pa zhes bya ba'i las dang lhan cig mi 'byung la /
translated: They do not occur simultaneously with the karma called volition, because they are mindless states.

original: sems med pa yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dag dang yang lhan cig mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: sems med pa yin pa'i phyir lus dang ngag gi las dag dang yang lhan cig mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They also do not occur simultaneously with the karma of body and speech.

original: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa thob pa rnams kyis kyang 'phen pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa thob pa rnams kyis kyang 'phen pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not projected by the obtainment of karma that has a ripened result,

original: las dang 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las dang 'bras bu mi gcig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the karma and its result are not the same.

original: thob pa rnams ni de 'phen par byed pa'i las dang lhan cig pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni de 'phen par byed pa'i las dang lhan cig pa yin mod kyi /
translated: Obtainment does occur simultaneously with the karma that projects it,

original: de dang 'bras bu gcig pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dang 'bras bu gcig pa ni ma yin te /
translated: but it is not the same result as that karma.

original: thob pa rnams ni shing gi phyi shun lta bur phyi rol na gnas pa yin pas so //
analyzed: thob pa rnams ni shing gi phyi shun lta bur phyi rol na gnas pa yin pas so //
translated: Obtainment is like the outer bark of a tree, which is external to the tree.üîΩObtainment is not projected by karmic obscuration,

original: las kyi sgrib pas zhes bya ba ni las nyid sgrib pa yin zhing /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pas zhes bya ba ni las nyid sgrib pa yin zhing /
translated: because karma itself is an obscuration,

original: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa nyid sgrib pa yin la /
translated: afflictions themselves are obscurations,

original: rnam par smin pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas so //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa nyid sgrib pa yin pas so //
translated: and the ripened result itself is an obscuration.

original: 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam la sbyor bar byed pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams zhes bya ba ni dro bar gyur pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The roots of virtue that cause one to be joined to the noble path are the heat stage, etc.

original: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags su nges par 'gyur ba dag go //
analyzed: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang yi dags su nges par 'gyur ba dag go //
translated: The karma that is certain to produce an unfortunate realm, etc. is the karma that is certain to produce a hell being, an animal, or a hungry ghost.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshangs pa chen por 'gyur bar nges pa'i las kyang bsdu la /üîΩza ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis par 'gyur ba yang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni 'du shes med pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dang tshangs pa chen por 'gyur bar nges pa'i las kyang bsdu la / za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan gnyis par 'gyur ba yang brjod par bya'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the karma that is certain to produce the meditative attainment of non-apperception and the great Brahma.üîΩIt should also be mentioned that there is karma that is certain to produce a eunuch, a neuter, or a hermaphrodite.

original: de bzhin du sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / drod gsher las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med nyid du 'gyur ba dang / srid pa brgyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i las dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du sgo nga las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / drod gsher las skye bar 'gyur ba dang / bud med nyid du 'gyur ba dang / srid pa brgyad par nges par 'gyur ba'i las dag kyang brjod par bya ste /
translated: Similarly, there is karma that is certain to produce birth from an egg, birth from heat and moisture, the female sex, and the eighth existence.

original: 'phags pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par yang mi skye zhing /
analyzed: 'phags pa ni dmyal ba la sogs par yang mi skye zhing /
translated: Aryas are not born in the unfortunate realms, etc.

original: sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su yang mi skye la /
analyzed: sgo nga las skye ba dang / drod gsher las skye ba'i skye gnas su yang mi skye la /
translated: They do not take rebirth from eggs or from heat and moisture.

original: bud med nyid dang / srid pa brgyad pa yang 'grub par mi byed de /
analyzed: bud med nyid dang / srid pa brgyad pa yang 'grub par mi byed de /
translated: They do not take rebirth as a female or as one who will take eight existences.

original: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro //üîΩbstan par sla zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la bstan sla bas na bstan par sla ba ste /üîΩbstan pa sla ba nyid bstan par sla ba dag yin no //
analyzed: re ltar thogs na srid pa lan bdun pa yin pa'i phyir ro // bstan par sla zhing zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag la bstan sla bas na bstan par sla ba ste / bstan pa sla ba nyid bstan par sla ba dag yin no //
translated: Because they are at most stream enterers who take seven existences.üîΩEasy to teach means easy to teach to others.üîΩEasy to teach is the same as easy to teach.

original: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis gdags sla bas na gdags sla @74b ba'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du bdag nyid kyis gdags sla bas na gdags sla @74b ba'o ;
translated: Easy to designate means easy to designate by oneself.

original: / gdags sla ba nyid gdags par sla ba dag yin no //
analyzed: / gdags sla ba nyid gdags par sla ba dag yin no //
translated: Easy to designate is the same as easy to designate.

original: bstan par sla ba dang / gdags par sla ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs kyang yin no //
analyzed: bstan par sla ba dang / gdags par sla ba zhes bya ba 'di gnyis ni rnam grangs kyang yin no //
translated: Easy to teach and easy to designate are synonyms.

original: gzhi zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam gyi gzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhi zhes bya ba ni las kyi lam gyi gzhi ste /
translated: Basis means the basis of the karmic path.

original: mtshams med pa gsum gyi gzhi ni srog gcod pa'i las kyi lam yin no ;
analyzed: mtshams med pa gsum gyi gzhi ni srog gcod pa'i las kyi lam yin no ;
translated: The basis of the three heinous actions is the karmic path of taking life.

original: / gcig gi gzhi ni brdzun du smra ba'i las kyi lam yin no //
analyzed: / gcig gi gzhi ni brdzun du smra ba'i las kyi lam yin no //
translated: The basis of the first is the path of action of lying.

original: lnga ba'i gzhi ni srog gcod par sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: lnga ba'i gzhi ni srog gcod par sbyor ba yin te /
translated: The basis of the fifth is the preparation of killing.

original: de ltar na gzhi las bstan par sla zhing gdags par sla ba dag yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhi las bstan par sla zhing gdags par sla ba dag yin no //
translated: Thus, the basis is easy to teach and easy to designate.

original: 'bras bu ni thams cad kyi 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni thams cad kyi 'bras bu yid du mi 'ong ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is unpleasant for all.

original: 'gro ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba thob par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni dmyal ba'i 'gro ba thob par byed pa yin no //
translated: The destiny is the destiny of the hells.

original: skye ba ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba ni skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The rebirth is rebirth as an animal.

original: gang zag ni nyon mongs pa chen po kun du spyod pa'i phyir gang zag 'di ni pha gsod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: gang zag ni nyon mongs pa chen po kun du spyod pa'i phyir gang zag 'di ni pha gsod par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The person is the person who is known to have committed a great sin, such as the person who kills his father,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la ngan sems kyis khrag 'byin par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar yin no //
translated: up to the person who maliciously draws the blood of a Tathagata.

original: gzhan dag na re gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re gzhi ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Others say: The basis is as before.

original: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu dmyal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ni 'bras bu dmyal ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The result is the result of the hells.

original: 'gro ba ni mi'i 'gro ba can byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'gro ba ni mi'i 'gro ba can byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it is the human realm that is the basis of the act.

original: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod //üîΩces 'byung bas so //
analyzed: mtshams med gling gsum dag na yod // ces 'byung bas so //
translated: The heinous acts exist in the three continents.

original: skye ba ni de kho na dang 'dra bar skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas so //
analyzed: skye ba ni de kho na dang 'dra bar skyes nas myong bar 'gyur ba yin pas so //
translated: Because birth is birth in the very next life, it is karma to be experienced in the next life.

original: gang zag ni skyes pa dang bud med dag yin gyi /
analyzed: gang zag ni skyes pa dang bud med dag yin gyi /
translated: The person is either male or female.

original: za ma dang / ma ning dag ni ma yin te /
analyzed: za ma dang / ma ning dag ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not a eunuch or neuter because it is said:

original: de ltar na rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing gdags par sla ba dag yin gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing gdags par sla ba dag yin gyi /
translated: The heinous acts are easy to explain and easy to designate by means of five causes.

original: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba'i las de dag ni rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing ;
analyzed: ngan song la sogs par nges par 'gyur ba'i las de dag ni rgyu lngas bstan par sla zhing ;
translated: But karma that definitely leads to lower rebirths and so on is not easy to explain and designate by means of five causes.

original: gdags par sla ba ma yin pas de dag ma bshad do zhes zer na'o //
analyzed: gdags par sla ba ma yin pas de dag ma bshad do zhes zer na'o //
translated: Therefore it is not explained.üîΩBecause it induces the latter.

original: phyi ma phyi ma 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas ni las kyi sgrib pa 'dren par byed la /
analyzed: phyi ma phyi ma 'dren pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pas ni las kyi sgrib pa 'dren par byed la /
translated: Thus the affliction of the heinous act induces the karma of the heinous act.

original: las kyi sgrib pas kyang ngan song du rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa 'dren par byed pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni thams cad pas sdig can no //
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pas kyang ngan song du rnam par smin pa mi 'dod pa 'dren par byed pas nyon mongs pa'i sgrib pa ni thams cad pas sdig can no //
translated: And also, karma to be experienced in the unfortunate planes of existence is the most sinful of all, since it leads to an undesirable karmic maturation.üîΩKarma to be experienced in the fortunate planes of existence is more sinful than that.üîΩKarma to be experienced in this life is more sinful than that.

original: las kyi sgrib pa ni de bas yang ngo //üîΩde bas ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste /üîΩrnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la bya ba byed kyi /
analyzed: las kyi sgrib pa ni de bas yang ngo // de bas ni rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ste / rnam par smin pa'i sgrib pa ni mthong ba'i chos kho na la bya ba byed kyi /
translated: Karma to be experienced in this life functions in this very life,

original: gnyis pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not in the other two.üîΩThe nature of the five heinous actions should be stated, since one becomes an immediate after the performance of any one of them.

original: pha gsod pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dang ldan pa'i phyir de bar @75a * //
analyzed: pha gsod pa la sogs pa'i chos gang dang ldan pa'i phyir de bar @75a * //
translated: The nature of the heinous actions is stated:üîΩThe heinous actions are the five.üîΩThe nature of the heinous actions is stated:üîΩThe heinous actions are the five.üîΩThe nature of the heinous actions is stated:üîΩThe heinous actions are the five.üîΩThe nature of the heinous actions is stated:üîΩThe heinous actions are the five.

analyzed: chad med pa yin pa de brjod par bya ba la /
translated: The nature of the heinous actions is stated:üîΩThe heinous actions are the five.

original: / byang gi sgra mi snyan na med //
analyzed: / byang gi sgra mi snyan na med //
translated: They do not exist in Uttarakuru.

original: ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de na bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces bya ba ni rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / de na bstan pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they possess natural morality and because there is no teaching there.üîΩThe reason why they do not have vows is the same reason why they do not have negative commitments.

original: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dag la yang bsam pa mi brtan pa'i phyir dang / gang la sdom pa yod pa de la sdom pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: sdom pa med pa'i gtan tshigs gang yin pa de nyid kyi phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sdig pa dag la yang bsam pa mi brtan pa'i phyir dang / gang la sdom pa yod pa de la sdom pa ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: Because their intentions are unstable with regard to evil, and because those who have vows also have negative commitments.

original: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyen por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are antidotes.

original: de lta bas na za ma la sogs pa la sdom pa ma yin pa med do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na za ma la sogs pa la sdom pa ma yin pa med do zhes bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that eunuchs and so on do not have negative commitments.

original: gang dag med par byas pas zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang pha ma la ngo tsha dang / khrel gang zhig med par byas shing nyams par byas pas za ma la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba shas chen por mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang dag med par byas pas zhes bya ba ni de dag kyang pha ma la ngo tsha dang / khrel gang zhig med par byas shing nyams par byas pas za ma la sogs pa mtshams med pa'i kha na ma tho bas reg par 'gyur ba shas chen por mi 'gyur te /
translated: They do not have a great deal of contact with the heinous karma of eunuchs and so on, because they have destroyed and impaired their shame and embarrassment with regard to their parents.

original: de'i phyir de dag gis mtshams med pa yin par mi 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gis mtshams med pa yin par mi 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, they do not consider them to be heinous acts.

original: gal te lus ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan ba chung ba nyid yin te /üîΩde'i phyir de dag gi mtshams med pa yin par mi 'dod na ;
analyzed: gal te lus ma tshang ba'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir phan ba chung ba nyid yin te / de'i phyir de dag gi mtshams med pa yin par mi 'dod na ;
translated: If you think that they are not heinous acts because they are of little benefit due to the incomplete body,

original: skyes pa dang bud med long ba la sogs pa yang /
analyzed: skyes pa dang bud med long ba la sogs pa yang /
translated: then the same would apply to the blind, the mute, and so on.

original: ma la sogs pa bsad pas mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /üîΩrtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i lus ma tshang ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma la sogs pa bsad pas mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te / rtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal ba'i lus ma tshang ba brjod par 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If a man or woman kills his or her mother and so on, they would not commit a heinous act.üîΩThis is not so, because the incomplete body that is incompatible with the Dharma is what is intended.

original: ma tshang ba rtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: ma tshang ba rtogs pa'i chos dang 'gal ba gang yin pa de'i dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: The incomplete body that is incompatible with the Dharma is what is intended.

original: des ni de kho nas byams pa chung ba nyid kyang yin gyi /
analyzed: des ni de kho nas byams pa chung ba nyid kyang yin gyi /
translated: That is because they have little love for their mothers due to that alone,

original: long ba la sogs pa'i ma tshang ba la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: long ba la sogs pa'i ma tshang ba la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not due to the incompleteness of the body, such as blindness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams la yang mi 'dod de /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams la yang mi 'dod de /
translated: Therefore they are not considered to be heinous acts for hungry ghosts and animals,

original: phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because they have little benefit and shame.

original: rta cang shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyang blo gsal ba phan rnams kyis mtshams med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rta cang shes bzhin no zhes bya ba ni yi dags dang / dud 'gro rnams kyang blo gsal ba phan rnams kyis mtshams med par 'gyur ro zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: Pretas and animals also have clear minds, so it is possible that they could commit heinous acts.üîΩThe wise horse is like the following story.

original: rta cang shes zhes bya ba ni dper na rta cang shes shig ma la mi rgal ba las gdong gos kyis g-yogs te /
analyzed: rta cang shes zhes bya ba ni dper na rta cang shes shig ma la mi rgal ba las gdong gos kyis g-yogs te /
translated: A wise horse was made to copulate with his mother. He was prevented from copulating with his mother, but his face was covered with a cloth.

original: ma la rgal du bcug pa dang / des phyi shes nas rang gi pho mtshan bcad do zhes grag ste /
analyzed: ma la rgal du bcug pa dang / des phyi shes nas rang gi pho mtshan bcad do zhes grag ste /
translated: When he realized what was happening, he castrated himself.

original: de @75b ltar na rta cang shes de blo gsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de @75b ltar na rta cang shes de blo gsal ba yin te /
translated: Thus, that wise horse had a clear mind.

original: de la mtshams med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: de la mtshams med par 'gyur ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: It is thought that he would have committed a heinous act.üîΩIf a human kills his human mother or father who are nonhumans, he does not commit a heinous act.

original: mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa bsad na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtshams med par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mi'i yang pha ma mi ma yin pa bsad na mtshams med par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mtshams med par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that he definitely does not commit a heinous act.

original: ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba kho na'i phyir te /
analyzed: phan pa dang ngo tsha chung ba kho na'i phyir te /
translated: Because he has little regard for his parents and little shame.

original: mi ma yin pas kyang mi dang 'tsham pa'i pham par bya bar mi nus la /
analyzed: mi ma yin pas kyang mi dang 'tsham pa'i pham par bya bar mi nus la /
translated: Nonhumans cannot defeat humans in a way that is appropriate to humans.

original: mi de yang pha ma mi ma yin pa dag la ngo tsha dang / khrel shas chen po yang dag par mi gnas te /

analyzed: phra rgyas dang bcas par spong bar byed pa ni nyon mongs pa de yang rjes su mi 'jug par byed ces bya ba'i don to //

analyzed: de ni phra rgyas kyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro /
translated: It is designated as negative tendencies because it is the cause of negative tendencies.

analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis rtsen pa ni mtshan nyid pa'o //

analyzed: mtshan nyid pa gang la yin zhe na /

analyzed: de'i phyir / nyon mongs pa kho na la zhes bya ba smos so //

analyzed: dmigs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i sgo nas rgyas par 'gyur bas de lta bas na phra rgyas rnams ni mtshungs par ldan pa kho na yin no //

original: don 'di la ni /
analyzed: don 'di la ni /

analyzed: phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin min //

analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pa dper rjod par byed de / sems ni nyon mongs byed phyir zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni /

analyzed: phra rgyas dang bcas pa'i sems la ni sngon med pa'i dge ba mi skye'o //

analyzed: dge dang 'gal phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di'i 'grel pa ni /

original: gal te de lta na ni ldan pa ma yin pa de dag rtag tu nye ba'i phyir dge ba rnams kyang dmigs par mi 'gyur ba zhig ste /

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /

analyzed: dge ba'ang dmigs pa'i phyir na 'dir //

original: phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin min //
analyzed: phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin min //

original: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gnas pa yin no //

original: slob dpon gyis bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis bye brag tu smra ba rnams kyis /

analyzed: sems ni nyon mongs byed phyir dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa gang yin pa 'di gtan tshigs su mi rung ste zhes bya ba smras so //

analyzed: gang zhig phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin par 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa'o //

original: 'di thams cad ces bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di thams cad ces bya ba ni sems nyon mongs pa can la sogs pa'o //

original: nyon mongs pas byas pa kho nar 'dod do zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pas byas pa kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas byas pa kho nar 'dod do zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pas byas pa kho nar zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /

analyzed: kun nas dkris pa ni rtag tu nye ba ma yin pas dge ba dmigs pa 'grub po //

original: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni zhes bya ba'i phyogs yongs su bzung na phra rgyas dang bcas par spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo dang ni 'gal ba med mod kyi /üîΩ'on kyang phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas ni zhes bya ba'i phyogs yongs su bzung na phra rgyas dang bcas par spong bar byed do zhes bya ba'i mdo dang ni 'gal ba med mod kyi / 'on kyang phra rgyas ldan pa ma yin pa yin no zhes bya bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir phra rgyas ni mtshungs par ldan pa yang ma yin la /
translated: If you accept the position that the negative tendency of desire realm attachment is abandoned by means of possessing negative tendencies, then there is no contradiction with the sutra that states:üîΩOne abandons that which possesses negative tendencies.

original: ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: ldan pa ma yin pa yang ma yin no zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: However, since it would follow that it is not concomitant with negative tendencies, it is said that negative tendencies are neither concomitant nor nonconcomitant.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /

original: de rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de rdzas gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /

original: nus pa'i ngo bo'i sa bon ni 'dod chags la sogs pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa'i ngo bo'i sa bon ni 'dod chags la sogs pa las don gzhan ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the seed of the essence of potentiality is not different from attachment, etc.

original: lus de rten gyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa sngar byung bas bskyed pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yin te /
analyzed: lus de rten gyi nyon mongs pa las skyes pa nyon mongs pa sngar byung bas bskyed pa nyon mongs pa bskyed pa'i mthu yin te /
translated: The body is generated from the afflictions that are its basis, and it is generated by the afflictions that arose previously.

original: nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skyed par byed pa'i mthu yin no //
translated: The potentiality is the power to generate the afflictions.

original: dper na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las skyes pa dran pa skyes pa'i mthu rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa las skyes pa dran pa skyes pa'i mthu rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, it is like the power to generate memory that arises from the consciousness that experiences an object, which is not a different substance.

original: la la dran pa skyed pa'i rgyu ldan pa ma yin pa rdzas gzhan zhig yin par 'dod par @90b dogs nas /
analyzed: la la dran pa skyed pa'i rgyu ldan pa ma yin pa rdzas gzhan zhig yin par 'dod par @90b dogs nas /
translated: Fearing that someone might think that the cause of the generation of memory is not a different substance,üîΩhe gives another example:

original: yang dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas pa dpe gzhan nye bar 'god de /
analyzed: yang dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba rgyas pa dpe gzhan nye bar 'god de /
translated: For example, it is like the power to generate a sprout, etc.

original: dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i s'a lu'i 'bras bu sngar byung ba las skyes pa s'a lu'i 'bras bu gzhan skyed par byed pa'i mthu rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na myu gu la sogs pa'i s'a lu'i 'bras bu sngar byung ba las skyes pa s'a lu'i 'bras bu gzhan skyed par byed pa'i mthu rdzas gzhan du gyur pa ma yin pa de dang 'dra'o //
translated: For example, the power of the rice seed that previously arose to generate another rice seed is not a different substance.

original: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa'o //
analyzed: gang zhig ces bya ba ni gnas ma'i bu'i sde pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSomeone‚Äù refers to the VƒÅtsƒ´putrƒ´yas.

original: gal te nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya bar 'dod na 'o na mdo las nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu ste /
analyzed: gal te nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas zhes bya bar 'dod na 'o na mdo las nyon mongs pa nyid phra rgyas su gang gsungs pa de ji lta bu ste /
translated: If you assert that the term ‚Äúnegative tendency‚Äù refers to the seeds of affliction, then how do you interpret the s≈´tra that states that the afflictions themselves are negative tendencies?

original: drug tshan drug pa'i mdo las /
analyzed: drug tshan drug pa'i mdo las /
translated: The S≈´tra of Six Hexads says:

original: gang zag 'di'i 'dod chags de bde ba'i tshor ba la rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang zag 'di'i 'dod chags de bde ba'i tshor ba la rgyas par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: The attachment of this person increases in relation to the feeling of pleasure.

original: 'dod chags kho na phra rgyas yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags kho na phra rgyas yin te /

original: bde ba'i tshor ba'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags kun du 'byung ba la de skad du gsungs kyi /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba'i gnas skabs na 'dod chags kun du 'byung ba la de skad du gsungs kyi /

original: de'i sa bon ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: It is not stated that it is the seed of attachment.

original: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na na ni phra rgyas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas de ni 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas kho na yin gyi /
analyzed: 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir de kho na na ni phra rgyas ma yin no zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ro zhes 'byung bas de ni 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas kho na yin gyi /

original: 'dod chags ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags ni ma yin no //
translated: This is the negative tendency of attachment, but it is not attachment.

original: gnas skabs de na 'dod chags de'i phra rgyas skye bar 'gyur bas sa bon skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
analyzed: gnas skabs de na 'dod chags de'i phra rgyas skye bar 'gyur bas sa bon skye bar 'gyur ba yin gyi /
translated: Since the negative tendency of attachment arises in that state, the seed arises.

analyzed: skyes pa ni ma yin pas der ni sa bon 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i gnas skabs brjod pa yin no snyam du bsam pa'o //
translated: But since it does not arise, it is said that the seed will arise in that state.üîΩWhen will it arise?

original: 'o na nam 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni nam zhig phra rgyas yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'o na nam 'gyur zhe na zhes bya ba ni nam zhig phra rgyas yod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means when will the negative tendency exist?üîΩWhen one is asleep, it will arise.

original: gang gi tshe nyal ba na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhig pa na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe nyal ba na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni gang gi tshe zhig pa na 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This means when one is dead, it will arise.üîΩOr this is a case of the cause being figuratively designated as the effect.

original: yang na 'di ni rgyu la nye bar btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dod chags la phra rgyas nye bar btags pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni rgyu la nye bar btags pa yin zhes bya ba ni rgyu 'dod chags la phra rgyas nye bar btags pa yin no //
translated: This means that the negative tendency is figuratively designated as attachment, the cause.

original: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas kyi rgyu yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas kyi rgyu yin te /
translated: Attachment is the cause of the proclivity of attachment.

original: 'di ltar 'dod chags skyed pa'i nus pa 'dod chags las skyes pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod chags skyed pa'i nus pa 'dod chags las skyes pa la 'dod chags kyi phra rgyas zhes bshad do //

original: de ni 'di skad du phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra kha cig tu ni sa bon la bya la /
analyzed: de ni 'di skad du phra rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra kha cig tu ni sa bon la bya la /
translated: This is what is being said: the term proclivity is used in some contexts to mean seed,

analyzed: kha cig tu ni kun nas dkris pa la bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: and in some contexts it means the fetters.

original: de dag ni phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa la 'dod chags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni de dag phal cher ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan la 'dod chags pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni phal cher snyoms par 'jug pa la 'dod chags pa yin la zhes bya ba ni de dag phal cher ro myang ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i bsam gtan la 'dod chags pa yin no //
translated: They are mostly attached to meditative attainment means that they are mostly attached to the meditative stabilization associated with relishing.

original: gzhal med khang la sogs pa la 'dod chags pa yang yod pas de'i phyir phal @91a * //
analyzed: gzhal med khang la sogs pa la 'dod chags pa yang yod pas de'i phyir phal @91a * //
translated: They are also attached to the celestial palaces and so on.

original: cher zhes bya ba smos so //üîΩde yang kha nang du bltas pa yin te /
analyzed: cher zhes bya ba smos so // de yang kha nang du bltas pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the term mostly is stated.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, they are internal since they are the nature of equipoise.

original: de ltar yin na thar pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: de ltar yin na thar pa'i 'du shes nye bar gnas par 'gyur ba /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de la 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang / srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: The Blessed One taught the attachment to desire realm objects and the attachment to existence in order to turn one away from that.

original: de ni srid pa la 'dod chags pa yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni srid pa la 'dod chags pa yin gyi /
translated: This is attachment to existence,

original: de thar pa la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de thar pa la ni ma yin te /
translated: not to liberation.

original: thar pa la ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin no //
analyzed: thar pa la ni dge ba'i chos la 'dun pa yin no //
translated: For liberation, there is aspiration for virtuous qualities.üîΩThe master‚Äôs position is that existence is the body alone.

original: lus kho na srid pa yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin no snyoms par 'jug pa rten dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa lus dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: lus kho na srid pa yin zhes bya ba ni slob dpon gyi gzhung lugs yin no snyoms par 'jug pa rten dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni snyoms par 'jug pa lus dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The statement ‚Äúabsorption together with its basis‚Äù means absorption together with the body.

original: ro myong bar byed pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir lus kho na ro myong bar byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: ro myong bar byed pa ni 'dod pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i phyir lus kho na ro myong bar byed pa yin gyi /
translated: One who relishes it relishes the body alone, because one is free from attachment to desire realm objects.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan dag ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan dag ni ma yin no //
translated: One does not relish the sense objects.

original: de'i phyir 'dod chags de ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dod chags de ni srid pa'i 'dod chags zhes bshad kyi 'dod pa'i 'dod chags zhes ni ma yin no zhes ston par byed do //
translated: Therefore it is called attachment to existence, but it is not called attachment to the desire realm.

original: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba ni mdo las ni ma yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
analyzed: chos mngon pa las zhes bya ba ni mdo las ni ma yin no snyam du bsam pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúin the Abhidharma‚Äù means in the sutras.üîΩSeven are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin.

original: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs par byed pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba bdun zhes bya ba ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba ni 'bras bur gyur pa nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la dmigs par byed pa yin pas sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: The afflicted view of the self focuses on the five appropriated aggregates that are the result of karma and the afflictions and is therefore to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: de bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang phung po de dag nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de bzhin du mthar 'dzin par lta ba yang phung po de dag nyid la rtag pa dang chad pa'i mthar 'dzin pa'i phyir la /

original: tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pa yang phung po de dag nyid la 'dag pa dang grol ba dang nges par 'byung bar dmigs par byed pa yin pas na kun 'byung ba mthong bas spang bar bya ba ma yin te /

translated: Also, the overesteeming of morality and asceticism is not to be abandoned by seeing the truth of origin because it focuses on those aggregates as pure, liberated, and as definite release.

original: de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o //üîΩlam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas bsnan te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gog pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba la yang sbyar bar bya'o // lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni brgyad de zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs mchog tu 'dzin pas bsnan te /
translated: The same should be applied to that which is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of cessation.üîΩEight are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path.

original: lam gyis 'dag par 'gyur ba de bor nas gzhan tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag 'dag par yid ches pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: lam gyis 'dag par 'gyur ba de bor nas gzhan tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis 'dag 'dag par yid ches pas log par zhugs pa'i phyir lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: The overesteeming of morality and asceticism is added to the seven that are to be abandoned by seeing the truth of the path because it wrongly engages the path, since it discards the path that purifies and believes in purification through other paths, such as morality and asceticism.

original: nyon mongs pa gang zhig bden pa gang la skur pa 'debs par @91b zhugs pa de ni de mthong na spong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang zhig bden pa gang la skur pa 'debs par @91b zhugs pa de ni de mthong na spong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Any affliction that engages in deprecation of a truth is abandoned by seeing that truth.

original: thag par mthong bas sbrul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
analyzed: thag par mthong bas sbrul du 'khrul pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the error of a rope being a snake.

analyzed: bden pa rnams mthong ba tsam gyis spong ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni goms pas spong ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsam pa yin no //

analyzed: bden pa mthong ba phyis lam goms par byas pas spong ba'i phyir ci zhe na /

analyzed: de dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The context is that they are objects to be abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: de ltar na sgom pa ni goms pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na sgom pa ni goms pa yin te /
translated: Thus, meditation is cultivation.

original: yang dang yang du skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dang yang du skyed par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is synonymous with repeatedly generating.

original: de dag ni ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi la rtag pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni ji lta bu yin zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa bzhi la rtag pa yin te /
translated: What are they? The four afflictions of attachment and so on are permanent.

original: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa de dag ni bshad ma thag pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / khong khro ba dang / nga rgyal dang / ma rig pa de dag ni bshad ma thag pa yin la /
translated: Attachment, anger, pride and ignorance are just as they were explained.

analyzed: de dag kyang 'di dag ni mthong bas spang bar bya'o //
translated: They are objects to be abandoned by the path of seeing.

original: 'di dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcad par dka' bas so //
analyzed: 'di dag ni bsgom pas spang bar bya'o zhes bya bar yongs su gcad par dka' bas so //
translated: It is difficult to determine that these are abandoned by the path of meditation.

original: 'jig tshogs la sogs pa la sems par byed pas ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig tshogs la sogs pa la sems par byed pas ni ma yin te /
translated: They are not objects of attention that are the view of the self and so on.

original: gang dag sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal gyi bden pa la log par zhugs pa de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: Those who wrongly engage the truth of suffering abandon objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

analyzed: de bzhin du gang dag lam la log par zhugs pa de dag ni lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du de lta bur yongs su bcad sla ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarly, those who wrongly engage the truth of path abandon objects to be abandoned by seeing the truth of path.

original: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la gang dag ces bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: In this context, those who are attachment and so on.

original: gang zhig mthong ba ni bden pa gang zhig mthong ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig mthong ba ni bden pa gang zhig mthong ba ste /
translated: That which is seen is the truth that is seen.

analyzed: de mthong bas spang bar bya ba ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: Those that are abandoned by seeing that are the focal object of those that are abandoned by seeing that.üîΩThey are the focal object of those that are abandoned by seeing that.

original: 'di skad du 'dod chags la sogs pa gang dag sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba nas lam mthong bas spang bar bya ba'i bar gyi nyon mongs pa la dmigs par byed pa de dag ni de mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no zhes bshad paüîΩyin no // ma rig pa'i phra rgyas ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi char la yang dmigs pa can yang @92a * //

analyzed: gcig bsdus pa'i tshul gyis 'grub pa'i phyir brjod par bya mi dgos te /

original: ris lnga char la dmigs pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: ris lnga char la dmigs pa yin mod kyi /

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni med de /

original: rnam pa'i dbye ba ni med de /
